result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter M Arendt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Columbia County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

No contact with James C. Koepp.  Anger management evaluation and comply, and any other counseling that the agent recommends.  Submit DNA sample.  Cost to be paid within the 1st year of probation.  Probation may be served out of Milwaukee.  Repeater enhancer dismissed.

filed by atty Marola
Filed by ADA Christine M. Genda
filed by atty Thomas Marola

Defendant Peter M Arendt in court with attorney Thomas J. Marola.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to information.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Repeater enhancer dismissed.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years, concurrent to 10CF624.  Conditions of probation include:  No contact with J.K., $518.00 costs, anger management evaluation and comply, and any other counseling per agent recommendations.  Submit DNA sample.  Costs to be paid in first year of probation.  Probation may be served out of Milwaukee.  No jail credit.
Preliminary hearing at 12-10-2015 09:00 am
